item.title: Correct way to use this
item.dc:creator: @madgamer madgamer
item.description:
@madgamer wrote:

You could add an int to the command to make it show what the reason was

if(command.startsWith("banuser") && (playerRights >= 1)) try { int banReason = integer.parseInt(command.substring(8)); String victim = command.substring(9); PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim; System.out.println("Admin:"+playerName+" is banning "+victim); sendMessage("Player "+victim+" successfully banned"); appendToBanned(victim); if(banReason == 1) { playerHandler.messageToAll = victim+" has been banned by "+playerName+" for macroing."; } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Banning Error"); }

you could add more banReason statements for whatever you want it to be
